versionA.text: Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2. If the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5, discuss with your partner and enter the calculated value for t. (If you have the t distribution table, try to find the critical t for a .05, two-tailed test, you don’t need to enter this value)

versionB.text: Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2. If the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5, discuss with your partner and enter the calculated value for t. (If you have the t distribution table, try to find the critical t for a .05, two-tailed test, you don’t need to enter this value)
